definition: realgar wine (traditionally drunk during the Dragon Boat Festival 端午節|端午节[Duan1 wu3 jie2])
male/staminate/grand/imposing/powerful/mighty/person or state having great power and influence

sentences.english: People drink realgar wine to protect themselves from illness .
sentences.chinese: 大部分人喝雄黄酒保护本人免于生病。

sentences.english: I enjoy drinking realgar wine during the festival.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在端午节喝点雄黄酒。

sentences.english: Cherry mulberry and calamus, more buy realgar wine a pot of.
sentences.chinese: 樱桃桑椹与菖蒲，更买雄黄酒一壶。

sentences.english: The drinking of realgar wine is thought to remove poisons from the body.
sentences.chinese: 喝雄黄酒被认为是清除体内毒素。

sentences.english: Some people thought drank realgar wine can protect themselves from illness.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为喝雄黄酒保护自己免于生病。

sentences.english: At Dragon Boat Festival, we also drank realgar wine.
sentences.chinese: 在端午节，我们也喝雄黄酒。

sentences.english: Some people thought drank realgar wine can protect themselves from illness.
sentences.chinese: 有些人认为喝雄黄酒可以保护自己免于生病。

sentences.english: Announcements, updates, is said to ward off evil spraying noon.
sentences.chinese: 说是午时喷洒雄黄酒是避邪。

sentences.english: South China has the custom of drinking realgar wine during the Dragon Boat Festival.
sentences.chinese: 中国南方有端午节喝雄黄酒的风俗。

urine of boys under 12, used as medicine (TCM)
